Administrative Aide - I\n\n""Human Resource Management Office""
""Maternity Leave/Paternity Leave""\n* Medical Certificate (3 copies)\n* Birth Certificate of the Child (3 copies)
""Solo Parent Leave""\n* Photocopy of the Solo Parent’s ID (3 copies)

""Ten-day (VAWC) Leave under RA9262"" 
* Barangay Protection order (BPO) (3 copies) 
* Temporary/Permanent Protection Order from the court. (3 copies) 
* If protection order is not yet issued; a certification shall be sufficient. 
* In the absence of BPO/TPO/PPO/Certification, a police report specifying all pertinent details and medical certification may be considered.(3 copies)
""Rehabilitation Leave"" \n* Police Report (3 copies) \n* Medical Certificate stating the need for rest, recuperation and rehabilitation (3 copies)

""Special Leave Benefit for Women"" 
* Medical Certificate (3 copies) 
* Clinical Summary reflecting the gynecological disorder (surgery needed) (3 copies) 
* Histopathological Report, the Operative Technique, duration of surgery including operative period (period of confinement around surgery) and estimated period of recuperation. (3 copies)
""Special Emergency (Calamity) Leave"" \n* Records and other proof as may be necessary to validate residency of employee. (3 copies)
""Monetization of Leave Credits"" \n* Letter of request addressed to Head of Agency stating the valid and justifiable reasons. (3 copies)
""Terminal Leave"" \n* Proof of employee’s resignation or retirement or separation from service. (3 copies)
""Adoption Leave"" \n* Authentic copy of the Pre-Adoptive Placement Authority (3 copies)

Presidential Decree 965 -issued on July 20, 1976 Section 3. Applicants for marriage license shall, upon filing an application therefore, be ""obliged"" to receive instructions and information on family planning and responsible parenthood from the Family Planning Office. It is also mandated in the RA 10354 RPRH Law.
2. The applicant contracting parties will accomplish the ""Marriage Expectation Inventory Form (MEIF);""

4. Return to attend PMO Session. 

""Case 1:"" Regular PMO Session every 1st Thursday of the Month 

""Case 2:"" Special PMO Session (Anytime)
